[[File:FIgure D.jpg|vignette|Squamous cell carcinoma: irregular ulcerative-vegetative tumour, covered with crusts, with inflammatory margins and indurated base. ]]

question.question: Which of the following best describes the characteristics of a typical squamous cell carcinoma as shown in the photograph?
question.option_a: A smooth, non-ulcerative lesion with well-defined margins and a soft base.
question.option_b: An irregular ulcerative-vegetative tumour covered with crusts, with inflammatory margins and an indurated base.
question.option_c: A flat, pigmented lesion with irregular borders and a soft, spongy texture.
question.option_d: A raised, nodular growth with a shiny surface and a firm, non-indurated base.
